JUDGES: Dmitry Dedov;Erik Møse;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Ksenija Turković
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr NORP PERSON , is an NORP and NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE , the applicant ’s father , claimed restitution of his family ’s property , an apartment building in GPE , which had been unlawfully expropriated in DATE . His property restitution claim , filed in the context of the ownership reform process taking place in GPE at that time , gave rise to a number of administrative and court proceedings . The main issues in the proceedings , in brief , were the following : on which grounds Y. ’s father , PERSON , had left GPE in DATE ; whether he had already received compensation for the property left in GPE and unlawfully expropriated by the NORP authorities ; and what the legal implications of these facts were .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE ( case no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) ORG found for Y. in his complaint against a decision of DATE of ORG for the Return of and Compensation for ORG ( NORP võõrandatud vara tagastamise ja kompenseerimise PERSON linnakomisjon ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE Y. died and the applicant pursued the proceedings as his successor .

CARDINAL . Following an appeal by ORG , on DATE ORG quashed ORG judgment . It annulled the decision of ORG on the ground that pertinent evidence had not been assessed and ordered ORG Y. ’s claim for the return of the property . ORG noted in its judgment that it did not instruct the ORG to reach any particular outcome in resolving the matter . The ORG appealed . On DATE ORG declined to examine the ORG ’s appeal and ORG judgment became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , dissatisfied with the ORG ’s delayed examination of his claim , requested that ORG impose a fine on ORG for its failure to comply with the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided to postpone the examination of Y. ’s claim pending the receipt of information from the NORP archives on whether PERSON ’s father had received compensation for the property in question from GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG fined the Committee CARDINAL kroons ( EEK ) ( MONEY ) for its failure to resolve the matter . It noted that ORG had taken certain measures in order to gather the information required to reach a decision , but found that the delay was unjustified .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the ORG ’s appeal against that decision . ORG appealed to ORG , which declined to examine the appeal on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In the meantime , on DATE , the ORG issued a decision by which it declared that the property in question was subject to the ownership reform process and that Y. ’s successors ( that is , the applicant ) were “ legally entitled subjects ” ( õigustatud subjektid ) in respect of the property . The decision contained a summary of the prior proceedings including , inter alia , reference to ORG judgment of DATE , by which ORG had been ordered to reexamine Y. ’s claim for the return of the property .

CARDINAL . On DATE , having , in the meantime , received information from the NORP archives , according to which ORG ’s father had received compensation in DATE from GPE for his property left in GPE , the ORG invalidated its decision of DATE and dismissed ORG ’s request for the return of the property . The decision also contained a summary of the prior proceedings , similar to the decision of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the ORG ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG annulled the ORG ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG , the ORG ’s legal successor , appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG judgment and dismissed the applicant ’s complaint against the ORG ’s impugned decision . ORG upheld ORG finding that Y. ’s father had already received compensation for the property concerned from GPE . It also found that the ORG had been entitled to re - examine the case after the new facts had arisen and to take a new decision . The applicant did not appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declined to examine an appeal lodged by PERSON , another claimant in the proceedings alongside the applicant .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , and parallel to the above - mentioned administrative court proceedings , the parties were involved in civil litigation . Following the annulment of certain administrative decisions , as a result of which ORG had acquired title to the property in question , GPE brought an action against DATE succeeded by the applicant . GPE claimed title to the property .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found for GPE and recognised their title . Y. appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the proceedings pending the outcome of the administrative court proceedings in case no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL - CARDINAL . On DATE the examination of the case was resumed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal and upheld ORG judgment . It took note of the applicant ’s argument that the question of the return of the property had not been finally resolved in the context of the ownership reform and that the administrative courts had ordered GPE to re - examine the matter . Nevertheless , the court found that it was not within its jurisdiction to resolve administrative matters and that it was still for GPE to decide in administrative proceedings whether the property was to be returned to the applicant .
